clinical_study.brief_title: Short-course Antimicrobial Therapy for Paediatric Respiratory Infections
clinical_study.official_title: Short-course Antimicrobial Therapy for Paediatric Respiratory Infections

brief_summary.textblock: Randomized controlled double-blind non-inferiority clinical trial to determine whether five days of high-dose amoxicillin leads to comparable rates of early clinical cure compared with 10 days of high-dose amoxicillin for previously healthy children with mild community-acquired pneumonia.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Early clinical cure (Resolution of tachypnoea, increased work of breathing, and fever)
primary_outcome.description: Resolution of tachypnoea, increased work of breathing, and fever

secondary_outcome.measure: Days of missed/disrupted work for caregiver(s)

arm_group.description: 5 days amoxicillin 90 mg/kg/day divided TID followed by 5 days placebo TID
5 days amoxicillin 90 mg/kg/day divided TID followed by alternate formulation 5 days amoxicillin 90 mg/kg/day divided TID

intervention.description: Experimental arm must receive 5 days placebo after 5 days amoxicillin to preserve blinding.
